intro: Galium pisoderium, commonly known as the common bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing herb with opposite, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its stems are usually prostrate or ascending, and it often forms dense mats in moist, shaded environments. Galium pisoderium is part of the Rubiaceae family and is known for its aromatic leaves and historical use in herbal medicine.
